resources.string: Use as if a USB security key were attached to that device.\nSetup steps available on your phone.
Hold to NFC-capable phone, even while on watch face.
NFC is not available on your watch

Registrations made in single-factor mode allow you to log in to certain sites without username or password.

Single-factor mode and passwordless login will be disabled if you turn off your screen lock and cannot be activated again without a full reset of WearAuthn.

Continue?
Log in to certain sites without username and password
Requires a full reset since screen lock had been disabled

How to use
Pair a Bluetooth​-​enabled device running Windows 10 (with Chrome, Firefox or Edge), macOS (with Chrome) or ChromeOS with your watch and connect to it from the WearAuthn main menu. You will be able to use your watch just like you would a USB security key plugged into the device.

To use WearAuthn with your NFC​-​enabled Android phone or iPhone (iOS 13.3+), just hold it to your watch when it tells you to “Use your Security Key”. This works even if WearAuthn is not running, as long as you wake your watch before holding it to your phone.
Confirm deletion of all credentials?\nYou will lose access to your accounts if you don\'t have a backup second factor.

Scroll down for the confirmation button.










Really confirm deletion of all credentials?
Add a device shortcut to your watch face
Informs you about functionality unlocked on your watch by in-app purchases made on your phone.
Add a device shortcut complication from your watch face\'s settings.
